item.title: H.R. 3892, Muslim Brotherhood Terrorist Designation Act of 2015
Muslim Brotherhood Terrorist Designation Act of 2015
To require the Secretary of State to submit a report to Congress on the designation of the Muslim Brotherhood as a foreign terrorist organization, and for other purposes.
Muslim Brotherhood Terrorist Designation Act of 2015

item.name: Introduced in House
item.text:
Muslim Brotherhood Terrorist Designation Act of 2015

Expresses the sense of Congress that: (1) the Muslim Brotherhood has met the criteria for designation as a foreign terrorist organization, and (2) the Department of State should so designate it.

Requires the State Department to report to Congress within 60 days whether the Muslim Brotherhood meets the criteria for foreign terrorist designation and, if not, which criteria have not been met.

bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 163 (Tuesday, November 3, 2015)][Pages H7624-H7625]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. DIAZ-BALART:H.R. 3892.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:[[Page H7625]]Article I, Sec. 8, Clause 3 and Article I, Sec8, Clause 18

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
